abstract.text: Returns an image provider from an OpenGL texture.

inlineContent.text: Quartz Composer OpenGL API deprecated. (Define QC_SILENCE_GL_DEPRECATION to silence these warnings)

platforms.message: Quartz Composer OpenGL API deprecated. (Define QC_SILENCE_GL_DEPRECATION to silence these warnings)
platforms.name: macOS

inlineContent.text: The pixel format of the texture. This must be compatible with the color space.
The width, in bytes, of the texture.
The height, in bytes, of the texture.
An OpenGL texture of type
that is valid on the Quartz Composer OpenGL context. Your application must make sure that the texture exists for the life cycle of the image provider.
to have Quartz Composer flip the contents of the texture vertically.
The release callback.  Your callback must use this type definition:

code: typedef void (*QCPlugInTextureReleaseCallback)(CGLContextObj cgl_ctx, GLuint name, void* context);

inlineContent.text: If you name your callback function
, you would declare it like this:
Quartz Composer invokes your callback when the memory buffer is no longer needed. The callback can be called from any thread at any time
The context to pass to the release callback.
The color space of the texture. This must be compatible with the pixel format.
A Boolean that specifies whether Quartz Composer should color match the texture. Pass
if the texture is a mask or gradient or should not be color matched for some other reason. Otherwise, pass
An image provider.
You must not modify the texture until the release callback is invoked.

abstract.text: Allow users to browse, edit, and save images, using slideshows and Core Image filters.
Performs the processing or rendering tasks appropriate for the custom patch.
protocol defines methods that you use only from within the execution method (
Returns an image provider from a single memory buffer.
Returns an image provider from an OpenGL texture.
A profile that specifies how to interpret a color value for display.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
